intro: Byttneria scalpellata var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid byttneria, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
